update.description:
* Change all to package://vrx\_gazebo
* Fully functional solution, with model.config errors only when non\_competition\_mode:=false
update.title: Fix RVIZ Mesh Issue

content.raw: Tyler, works for me. Thanks for the fix!
content.html: Tyler, works for me. Thanks for the fix!

content.raw: Let me know if you think the solution works, and approve if it looks good.
content.html: Let me know if you think the solution works, and approve if it looks good.

content.raw:
```
wamv_description
├── CHANGELOG.rst
├── CMakeLists.txt
├── models
│   ├── engine
│   │   ├── mesh
│   │   │   └── engine.dae
│   │   └── model.config
│   ├── propeller
│   │   ├── mesh
│   │   │   └── propeller.dae
│   │   └── model.config
│   └── WAM-V-Base
│       ├── mesh
│       │   ├── WAM-V-Base.dae
│       │   └── WamV.png
│       └── model.config
```

vs.

```
wamv_description
├── CHANGELOG.rst
├── CMakeLists.txt
├── mesh
│   ├── engine.dae
│   ├── propeller.dae
│   ├── WAM-V-Base.dae
│   └── WamV.png
```

content.raw: Is there any reason that gps, WAM-V-Base, etc. are not already models? I just find it a bit strange that we have a 3d\_lidar model, but not a gps or battery model.
content.html: Is there any reason that gps, WAM-V-Base, etc. are not already models? I just find it a bit strange that we have a 3d_lidar model, but not a gps or battery model.

content.raw:
I don't have a big preference. I think that \(1\) may be a bit better because it makes more sense that `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models ` and `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/models` and `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description/models` are part of GAZEBO\_MODEL\_PATH, instead of `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx`, which feels more like a hack fix. 

The only "hacky" thing in \(1\) is that I need to turn all `package://vrx_gazebo/models/battery...` ->`` `package://battery..`` in a tmp file, which should be okay because we shouldn't ever need to call `gz model ...` except for this one spawn fix.
content.html:
I don't have a big preference. I think that (1) may be a bit better because it makes more sense that /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models and /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/models and /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description/models are part of GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, instead of /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx, which feels more like a hack fix.

The only "hacky" thing in (1) is that I need to turn all package://vrx_gazebo/models/battery... ->`package://battery.. in a tmp file, which should be okay because we shouldn't ever need to call gz model ... except for this one spawn fix.

content.raw: Do you have a particular preference? I’m leaning towards \(1\).
content.html: Do you have a particular preference? I’m leaning towards (1).

content.raw:
**How to test 1** [**f7f7796**](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/f7f7796e8b41b23b3a7178af9ced3d12bcfaa32d?at=default) **Fully functional solution, with urdf file modified when calling spawn\_wamv.bash and giving proper model dirs to wamv\_gazebo and wamv\_description**

**TEST 1**

_Terminal 1_

`hg update f7f7796` `source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

**TEST 2**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true non_competition_mode:=false`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

**TEST 3**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch camera_enabled:=true gps_enabled:=true imu_enabled:=true verbose:=true`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

---

**How to test 2** [**393ccbb**](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/393ccbbf7027cb72a19a4829592c3256c42ddba7?at=default) **Fully functional solution, with model.config errors only when non\_competition\_mode:=false**

**TEST 1**

_Terminal 1_

`hg update 393ccbb` `source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

**TEST 2**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true non_competition_mode:=false`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be the expected model.config errors present in the sandisland launch.

**TEST 3**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch non_competition_mode:=false`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

**TEST 4**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch camera_enabled:=true gps_enabled:=true imu_enabled:=true verbose:=true`

_Terminal 2_

`rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`

_Terminal 3_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch wamv_gazebo rviz_vrx.launch`

Should be no errors present.

content.raw:
If running sandisland instead of vrx, rviz will show no image for cameras because there are no cameras. This is normal.

‌

Also, the link starts as odom, but there is no odom link, so the boat starts white. You can change it to base\_link and you will see the boat with all its meshes.
content.html:
If running sandisland instead of vrx, rviz will show no image for cameras because there are no cameras. This is normal.

‌

Also, the link starts as odom, but there is no odom link, so the boat starts white. You can change it to base_link and you will see the boat with all its meshes.

content.raw:
**Original Issue** 

When following tutorial [#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing%20with%20RViz](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing%20with%20RViz), there are errors like:

```
[ERROR] [1565646595.593786107, 28.110000000]: Could not load resource [model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae]: Unable to open file "model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae".
[ERROR] [1565646595.595902926, 28.113000000]: Could not load model 'model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae' for link 'cpu_cases_link': OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae in resource group Autodetect or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /build/ogre-1.9-B6QkmW/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
[ERROR] [1565646595.596011230, 28.113000000]: Could not load model 'model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae' for link 'cpu_cases_link': OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae in resource group Autodetect or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /build/ogre-1.9-B6QkmW/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
[ERROR] [1565646595.716515686, 28.232000000]: Could not load resource [model://mono_camera/mesh/mono_camera.dae]: Unable to open file "model://mono_camera/mesh/mono_camera.dae".
```

  
This is fundamentally because we have an uneven model/mesh file structure. We have some meshes in vrx\_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, but others in wamv\_gazebo/mesh/<model>.dae or wamv\_description/mesh/<model>.dae. 

Rviz needs `robot_description` to have meshes in the form of `package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae` or `package://wamv_gazebo/mesh/gps.dae`.  It does not acknowledge `model://` and it leads to errors.

We also use `gz model` to spawn a wamv and it does not care if it is either `package://` or `model://`. However,  the remaining path must be relative to \`GAZEBO\_MODEL\_PATH\`.

I have implemented two solutions. Please compare them and let me know which looks better:

**1** [**f7f7796**](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/f7f7796e8b41b23b3a7178af9ced3d12bcfaa32d?at=default) **Fully functional solution, with urdf file modified when calling spawn\_wamv.bash and giving proper model dirs to wamv\_gazebo and wamv\_description**

This involves making the model/mesh file structure consistent, so that we now have vrx\_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, wamv\_description/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, wamv\_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae. From here, `robot_description` has meshes in the form of `package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae` or `package://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae`.  

To make it work with `gz model`, I added code to the script to change all `package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae` =>  `package://3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae` and`package://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae` => `package://gps/mesh/gps.dae`.  Now if we have \`GAZEBO\_MODEL\_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/wamv\_description/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/wamv\_gazebo/models\`, it works reliably.

**Summary: This way works perfectly, except that it forces us to treat gps, WAM-V-Base like Gazebo models. Currently that leaves us with these Fake Models and Errors if they are pressed.**

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/4233133010-image.png)
```
Error [parser.cc:334] Error finding file [/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/models/gps/model.sdf].
```

‌

**2** [**393ccbb**](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/393ccbbf7027cb72a19a4829592c3256c42ddba7?at=default) **Fully functional solution, with model.config errors only when non\_competition\_mode:=false**

This involves leaving everything as is, making `robot_description` have meshes in the form of `package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae` or `package://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae`.  Then having \`GAZEBO\_MODEL\_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx\`. This is perfectly functional, except it has errors when running in `non_competition_mode:=false`

‌

**Summary: This way works perfectly, except that it outputs the following error ONLY when verbose:=true and non\_competition\_mode:=false. No error if non-verbose or if non\_competition\_mode.**  

```
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../.hg"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../docker"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../images"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../tools"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../usv_gazebo_plugins"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../vrx_gazebo"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../wamv_description"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../wamv_gazebo"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../wave_gazebo"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../wave_gazebo_plugins"
```
content.html:
Original Issue

When following tutorial #!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing%20with%20RViz, there are errors like:

[ERROR] [1565646595.593786107, 28.110000000]: Could not load resource [model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae]: Unable to open file "model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae".
[ERROR] [1565646595.595902926, 28.113000000]: Could not load model 'model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae' for link 'cpu_cases_link': OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae in resource group Autodetect or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /build/ogre-1.9-B6QkmW/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
[ERROR] [1565646595.596011230, 28.113000000]: Could not load model 'model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae' for link 'cpu_cases_link': OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource model://cpu_cases/mesh/cpu_cases.dae in resource group Autodetect or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /build/ogre-1.9-B6QkmW/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
[ERROR] [1565646595.716515686, 28.232000000]: Could not load resource [model://mono_camera/mesh/mono_camera.dae]: Unable to open file "model://mono_camera/mesh/mono_camera.dae".

This is fundamentally because we have an uneven model/mesh file structure. We have some meshes in vrx_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, but others in wamv_gazebo/mesh/<model>.dae or wamv_description/mesh/<model>.dae.

Rviz needs robot_description to have meshes in the form of package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae or package://wamv_gazebo/mesh/gps.dae. It does not acknowledge model:// and it leads to errors.

We also use gz model to spawn a wamv and it does not care if it is either package:// or model://. However, the remaining path must be relative to `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`.

I have implemented two solutions. Please compare them and let me know which looks better:

1 f7f7796 Fully functional solution, with urdf file modified when calling spawn_wamv.bash and giving proper model dirs to wamv_gazebo and wamv_description

This involves making the model/mesh file structure consistent, so that we now have vrx_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, wamv_description/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae, wamv_gazebo/models/<model>/mesh/<model>.dae. From here, robot_description has meshes in the form of package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae or package://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae.

To make it work with gz model, I added code to the script to change all package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae => package://3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae andpackage://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae => package://gps/mesh/gps.dae. Now if we have `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/models`, it works reliably.

Summary: This way works perfectly, except that it forces us to treat gps, WAM-V-Base like Gazebo models. Currently that leaves us with these Fake Models and Errors if they are pressed.

Error [parser.cc:334] Error finding file [/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/models/gps/model.sdf].

‌

2 393ccbb Fully functional solution, with model.config errors only when non_competition_mode:=false

This involves leaving everything as is, making robot_description have meshes in the form of package://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae or package://wamv_gazebo/models/gps/mesh/gps.dae. Then having `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx`. This is perfectly functional, except it has errors when running in non_competition_mode:=false

‌

Summary: This way works perfectly, except that it outputs the following error ONLY when verbose:=true and non_competition_mode:=false. No error if non-verbose or if non_competition_mode. 

[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../.hg"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../docker"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../images"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../tools"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../usv_gazebo_plugins"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../vrx_gazebo"

[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/launch/../../wamv_gazebo"
